meanings.definition: Under or beneath that place or thing.
meanings.sent1: The treasure was hidden thereunder the old oak tree.
meanings.sent2: The map indicated that the cave entrance was located thereunder the waterfall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel buried its acorns thereunder the flower bed.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the ancient civilization lay thereunder the desert sands.
meanings.sent5: The lost key was discovered thereunder the pile of books.

meanings.sent1: The contract stated that payment must be made thereunder the terms agreed upon.
meanings.sent2: The rules clearly outlined the actions to be taken thereunder specific circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed his tricks thereunder the full moon, adding to the mystique.
meanings.sent4: The students were expected to complete the assignment thereunder the given instructions.
meanings.sent5: The team worked diligently thereunder the guidance of their coach.

meanings.sent1: The cat sat lazily thereunder the warm sunbeam.
meanings.sent2: The old house stood proudly thereunder the shade of the towering oak tree.
meanings.sent3: The children played happily thereunder the watchful eye of their parents.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed beautifully thereunder the care of the skilled gardener.
meanings.sent5: The boat rocked gently thereunder the calm night sky.
